intro: Adesmia landbeckii, commonly known as the Peruvian burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and succulent stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the dry season. Its leaves are opposite and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Adesmia landbeckii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
